Gilles Eda
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Cette présentation de la sclérose en plaques est relativement complète mais demande un bon vocabulaire médical.

X.T: Dépression - Vérités et Mensonges

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Anne-Marie Casteret
ARTICLE.COMMENT: L'auteur décrit l'historique de la dépression et de ses traitements au cours du siècle.

X.T: Du stent au stent imprégné

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Pierre Alain
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This interview of the cardiologist Philippe Geslin is a good introduction to stents.

X.T: Les parasomnies de l'enfant

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marie Josèphe Challamel
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Terreurs nocturnes, somnambulisme et énurésie.

X.T: New Jersey Paper Examines Vaccine, AIDS Connection Author Contends

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Carol Ann Campbell
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The journalist reports some comments on Hooper's book ("The River: A Journey to the Source of HIV and AIDS").

X.T: Map the Genome, Hack the Genome

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Michael Gruber
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author is looking for some hackers in the biotech industry.

X.T: Reebok recalls bracelet after boy's death in US

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Anil Dawar
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A Reebok's gift kills a young boy by lead poisoning.

X.T: Transrectal HIFU: The Next Generation?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Douglas O. Chinn
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A detailed presentation of High Intensity Focused Ultrasound for treating prostate cancer.

X.T: Marvin Minsky: Health, population and the human mind
Marvin Minsky: Health, population and the human mind

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marvin Minsky
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A hodgepodge of witty ideas.

X.T: HealthMap: Digital Disease Detection

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: John Brownstein
Clark Freifeld
Mikaela Keller
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the features and technology of HealthMap: scanning news to find disease reports and placing them on a world map.

X.T: New European cancer figures prompt action call

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The figures of cancer cases and deaths in Europe.

X.T: Health Care & Health-IT Under Obama

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Neil Versel
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The expected main points of Obama's future health policy: the uninsured and privacy.

X.T: Is IT ready for the Dreaded DNA Data Deluge?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Andras Pellionisz
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A messy presentation where Andras Pellionisz is mixing the IT challenges to handle huge data amounts, some startups trying to solve theses, and his own genomics theories ("Principle of Recursive Genome Function").

X.T: Steven Pinker: Chalking it up to the blank slate
Steven Pinker: Chalking it up to the blank slate

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Steven Pinker
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Steven Pinker talks about his book "The Blank Slate", where he claims against the dogma that people are born with the same mind, and answers to some critics about it.

X.T: Former KISS drummer: men get breast cancer too

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Peter Criss underwent a lumpectomy.

X.T: David Bolinsky: Fantastic voyage inside a cell
David Bolinsky animates a cell

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Bolinsky
ARTICLE.COMMENT: David Bolinsky presents an extract of an animation aimed at showing the "truth and beauty" of the cell machinery in order to spark interest in students.

X.T: Balance, Stress, and Optimal Health -- Personal Growth Speaker Series: Self-Healing Though Mind-Body Medicine

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Emmett Miller
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Emmett Miller explains his holistic approach of medicine. He explains that stress is a problem in our modern world because we have not rest period. He finishes with a relaxation experiment.

X.T: The Untapped Potential of a Potential Space

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Dan Burnett
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The peritoneal cavity can be used to placed medical devices in it.

X.T: Danny Hillis: Understanding cancer through proteomics
Danny Hillis: Understanding cancer through proteomics

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Danny Hills
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Danny Hillis explains proteomics and why they should be used to understand cancer instead on focusing only on genomics.

X.T: Ed Boyden: A light switch for neurons
Ed Boyden: A light switch for neurons

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ed Boyden
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Playing with genetics to get the brain cells being active or inactive when lighted.

X.T: Think faster focus better and remember more - Rewiring our brain to stay younger and smarter

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Michael Merzenich
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information about the brain plasticity and software products to help children catch up learning lateness.

X.T: Human Engine Optimization: Natural Strategies for High Ranking Health

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Stephen Devries
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A lot of statistics measuring the impact that food and life style have on the health.

X.T: Russell Foster: Why do we sleep?
Russell Foster: Why do we sleep?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Russell Foster
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some general information about sleep, some myths, some new findings in sleep and mental health relationship.

X.T: The Truth About Your Food

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Adiel Tel-Oren
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The subject is promising, but this presentation is boring, misses facts and is unconvincing.

X.T: Genetics and Intelligence

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Steve Hsu
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some Chinese and US researchers try to find some genes impacting the intelligence (meaning IQ, SAT, GRE... scores).
